author: Alice Newell-Hanson
title: Should I Splurge on $40 Hand Wash to Impress Guests?
text:
Yes 

It’s easy to roll your eyes and mutter that you’re not the sort of person who’d ever blow $39 on hand wash, until you smell it. Aesop’s Resurrection Aromatique, a current cult favorite among people who run ambitiously tasteful households and businesses, smells of rosemary, cedar and oranges. Its earthily minimalist dispenser and moisturizing plant oils can turn a mindless task, hand cleaning, into a minor joy (it might even persuade you to lather up more often). If you’re the kind of host who greets guests with marcona...
